title: PM did not attend national security meeting due to opposition’s reservations: NA
content:
ISLAMABAD, July 2 (APP): A spokesman of the National Assembly Secretariat Friday said that Prime Minister Imran Khan did not attend Thursday’s meeting of the Parliamentary Committee on National Security following the reservations by “some opposition leaders.”
The spokesman dubbed the media report regarding the non-participation of Prime Minister of Pakistan in a meeting of the Parliamentary Committee on National Security held in July 1, 2021, as factually incorrect.
Spokesman clarified that Prime Minister was always willing to attend meeting of Parliamentary Committee & the only reason of his not coming to Meeting was reservations conveyed to Assembly Secretariat by some opposition leaders.@appcsocialmedia @GovtofPakistan @PTVNewsOfficial
— National Assembly of Pakistan (@NAofPakistan) July 2, 2021
“Prime Minister was always willing to attend the meeting of the Parliamentary Committee and the only reason of his not coming to Meeting was reservations conveyed to Assembly Secretariat by some opposition leaders,” the spokesman clarified.
